original: @246a ` // de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi khyad par rgyas pa'i mdo sde'i man ngag bzhugs /
analyzed: @246a ` // de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi khyad par rgyas pa'i mdo sde'i man ngag bzhugs /
translated: The Instruction of the Sutra of the Extensive Special Pledges of the Seven Tathagatas

original: # // de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi khyad par rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i mdo sde bklag cing @246b de bzhin gshegs pa bdun mchod de smon lam gdab pa'i cho ga mdo sde las bsdus te rim par bklag pa /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi mdo bklag cing cho ga rim par mdzad pa /
analyzed: # // de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi khyad par rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i mdo sde bklag cing @246b de bzhin gshegs pa bdun mchod de smon lam gdab pa'i cho ga mdo sde las bsdus te rim par bklag pa / de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi mdo bklag cing cho ga rim par mdzad pa /
translated: The Sutra of the Extensive Special Pledges of the Seven Tathagatas, called the Sutra of the Ritual of Reciting the Seven Tathagatas and Making Aspirations🔽The Ritual of Reciting the Sutra of the Seven Tathagatas

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi smon lam gyi mdo bklag cing smon lam gdab pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi smon lam gyi mdo bklag cing smon lam gdab pa la /
translated: The Ritual of Reciting the Sutra of the Aspirations of the Seven Tathagatas and Making Aspirations

original: mgo mjug dus kun du gnod sems dang / 'khon dang / brnab sems dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / yid gnyis la sogs te nyon mongs pa'i skyon dang / sems ma 'dres par bsdam zhing bag bya /
analyzed: mgo mjug dus kun du gnod sems dang / 'khon dang / brnab sems dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / yid gnyis la sogs te nyon mongs pa'i skyon dang / sems ma 'dres par bsdam zhing bag bya /
translated: At the beginning, end, and all times, one should be bound and restrained by the faults of the afflictions, such as malice, enmity, covetousness, lack of faith, laziness, and doubt, and so forth, and by the mind not being mixed.

original: gzhu rdeg la sogs pa chad pa dang / gnod pa'i las ming yang mi grag par bya /
analyzed: gzhu rdeg la sogs pa chad pa dang / gnod pa'i las ming yang mi grag par bya /
translated: Do not even speak of the names of punishments such as whipping, and of harmful actions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi yon tan dang / mthu'i khyad par la yid ches shing mos par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi yon tan dang / mthu'i khyad par la yid ches shing mos par bya ste /
translated: Have confidence in and interest in the special qualities and powers of those Tathagatas.

original: bka' drin gzo zhing dang pa dang / dad pa dang gus pa'i sems cher bskyed /
analyzed: bka' drin gzo zhing dang pa dang / dad pa dang gus pa'i sems cher bskyed /
translated: Give rise to a mind of great gratitude, joy, faith, and respect.

original: mdo sde'i phan yon la yid ches pa nges par gzung /
analyzed: mdo sde'i phan yon la yid ches pa nges par gzung /
translated: Definitely take up confidence in the benefits of the sutras.

original: sems can la byams pa dang ; snying rje'i sems bskyed la /
analyzed: sems can la byams pa dang ; snying rje'i sems bskyed la /
translated: Give rise to a mind of love and compassion for sentient beings.

original: khyim pa zhig yin na bsnyen gnas kyi khrims bzung /
analyzed: khyim pa zhig yin na bsnyen gnas kyi khrims bzung /
translated: If you are a layperson, take up the precepts of the one-day upavasa vow.

original: btson dang bu lon can bdag la dbang yod pa rnams thar bar bya zhing /
analyzed: btson dang bu lon can bdag la dbang yod pa rnams thar bar bya zhing /
translated: Liberate those who are in your power, such as prisoners and debtors.

original: phongs pa rnams la dpung gnyen bya /
analyzed: phongs pa rnams la dpung gnyen bya /
translated: Be a protector for those who are destitute.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa brgyad dang / 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / skyabs grol gyi sku gzugs rgyu ci 'byor pa las gsar du bya /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa brgyad dang / 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / skyabs grol gyi sku gzugs rgyu ci 'byor pa las gsar du bya /
translated: Make new images of the eight Tathagatas, the noble Manjushri, Vajrapani, and Tara, using whatever materials you can afford.

original: gsar du ma 'byor na sku gzugs rnying pa ci bzhugs spyan drangs /
analyzed: gsar du ma 'byor na sku gzugs rnying pa ci bzhugs spyan drangs /
translated: If you cannot obtain new ones, then invite whatever old images you have.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi sngon gyi smon lam khyad par rgyas pa'i mdo sde /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi sngon gyi smon lam khyad par rgyas pa'i mdo sde /
translated: Read the Sutra of the Extensive Special Prayers of the Seven Tathagatas🔽continuously day and night for at least forty-nine days, but not more than that.

original: mchod pa zhag dus zin gyi bar du nyin mtshan rgyun mi 'chad par tshar bzhi bcu rtsa dgu las mi nyung bar bklag /'phags pa chos skyong ba dang gnod sbyin rnams la chos kyi sbyin pa dbul ba'i mdo sde bzang po grva gcig kyang rgyun du bklag /
analyzed: mchod pa zhag dus zin gyi bar du nyin mtshan rgyun mi 'chad par tshar bzhi bcu rtsa dgu las mi nyung bar bklag /'phags pa chos skyong ba dang gnod sbyin rnams la chos kyi sbyin pa dbul ba'i mdo sde bzang po grva gcig kyang rgyun du bklag /
translated: Also, always read in one corner a good sutra such as the Sutra of Offering the Gift of Dharma to the Noble Dharma Protectors and Yakshas.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun la zas dang skom dang yo byad thams cad kyis ci nus su mchod pa dang rim gro bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun la zas dang skom dang yo byad thams cad kyis ci nus su mchod pa dang rim gro bya'o //
translated: Make offerings and serve the Sangha of monks with food, drink, and all the necessities to the best of your ability.

original: mchod pa bya ba'i zhag grangs ni zhag bdun nam /
analyzed: mchod pa bya ba'i zhag grangs ni zhag bdun nam /
translated: The number of days for making offerings is seven days,

original: zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig gam /
analyzed: zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig gam /
translated: or twenty-one days,

original: sum cu rtsa lnga'am bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i bar du bya ste /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa lnga'am bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i bar du bya ste /
translated: or thirty-five days, or forty-nine days.

original: lcogs par byed na nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du mchod cing smon lam gdab /
analyzed: lcogs par byed na nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du mchod cing smon lam gdab /
translated: If you can manage it, make offerings and recite prayers three times a day and three times a night.

original: dam chos bklag pa dang mchod pa gzhan @247a * //
analyzed: dam chos bklag pa dang mchod pa gzhan @247a * //
translated: Read the holy Dharma and make offerings to the Three Jewels

original: rgyun mi 'chad par bya /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par bya /
translated: without interruption.

original: cho ga 'di sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bdun po'i mtshan thos shing brjod pa las phan yon 'byung ba yin pas phyag 'tshal ba dang bsngo ba'i bar du skabs ci yod par mtshan lan mang du smos shing /
analyzed: cho ga 'di sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bdun po'i mtshan thos shing brjod pa las phan yon 'byung ba yin pas phyag 'tshal ba dang bsngo ba'i bar du skabs ci yod par mtshan lan mang du smos shing /
translated: Since the benefits of this ritual come from hearing and reciting the names of the seven tathagatas through the power of their previous aspirations, you should recite their names many times in whatever spare moments you have, from the time of prostration up to the dedication.

original: ci nas kyang mang du thos shing brjod pa'i tshul du bya'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang mang du thos shing brjod pa'i tshul du bya'o //
translated: You should do this in such a way that you hear and recite them many times.

original: mchod pa'i yo byad 'og nas 'byung ba bzhin du bshams shing gtsang sgra che bar bya /
analyzed: mchod pa'i yo byad 'og nas 'byung ba bzhin du bshams shing gtsang sgra che bar bya /
translated: Arrange the offering articles as they appear below and make them clean and beautiful.

original: mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa la sogs pas yi ma shing rnga dang gar la sogs pa rol mo ci 'byor pa rgyas par bya //
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa la sogs pas yi ma shing rnga dang gar la sogs pa rol mo ci 'byor pa rgyas par bya //
translated: Make offerings with the five branches, cymbals, drums, and so forth, and whatever musical instruments you have, such as dance and song.

original: yon bdag dang mchod pa'i las la gtogs pa rnams khrus bya zhing gos gtsang ma nyin mchod pa lan du byed pa'i tshe spo zhing bgo'o //
analyzed: yon bdag dang mchod pa'i las la gtogs pa rnams khrus bya zhing gos gtsang ma nyin mchod pa lan du byed pa'i tshe spo zhing bgo'o //
translated: The benefactors and those who are involved in the work of making offerings should wash and put on clean clothes.

original: mchod pa'i rim pa ni yo byad tshul bzhin bshams kyi 'og tu dge 'dun dang yon bdag tshogs nas sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin bsgom ;
analyzed: mchod pa'i rim pa ni yo byad tshul bzhin bshams kyi 'og tu dge 'dun dang yon bdag tshogs nas sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin bsgom ;
translated: The sequence of the offerings: after the articles have been properly arranged, the Saṅgha and the benefactors gather. In order to pervade all sentient beings with love, one should cultivate meditative concentration.

original: de nas mchod pa'i tshogs rnams bden pa brdar zhing byin gyis brlab /
analyzed: de nas mchod pa'i tshogs rnams bden pa brdar zhing byin gyis brlab /
translated: Then, one should recite the truth and bless the collection of offerings.

original: de nas 'phags pa spyan drang /
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa spyan drang /
translated: Then, one should invite the noble ones.

original: de nas 'phags pa'i tshogs gdan 'dzom ste /
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa'i tshogs gdan 'dzom ste /
translated: Then, the assembly of noble ones gathers on the seats.

original: so so'i gdan la bzhugs par bsam /
analyzed: so so'i gdan la bzhugs par bsam /
translated: One should imagine that they sit on their respective seats.

original: de nas 'phags pa'i tshogs mngon du dmigs la gdan 'dzom pa'i spyi la phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod pa lnga dbul /
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa'i tshogs mngon du dmigs la gdan 'dzom pa'i spyi la phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod pa lnga dbul /
translated: Then, one should visualize the assembly of noble ones and pay homage to the general gathering of noble ones and make the five offerings.

original: bskul ba'i smon lam bklag / de bzhin gshegs pa brgyad la sogs pa re re la mchod pa dbul zhing mdo las 'byung bzhin smon lam gdab par tshar phyin par bya /
analyzed: bskul ba'i smon lam bklag / de bzhin gshegs pa brgyad la sogs pa re re la mchod pa dbul zhing mdo las 'byung bzhin smon lam gdab par tshar phyin par bya /
translated: Make offerings to each of the eight tathagatas and so forth and recite the aspiration prayers as they appear in the sutra.🔽Then everyone should recite as much as they can of the forty-nine-verse heart of the dharani, at least seven times.

original: de nas kun gyis gzungs kyi snying po logs shig tu phyung ba bzhi bcu rtsa dgu man chad bdun yan chad ci nus su bklag / de'i rjes la spyi la mchod pa lan cig byas nas bsod nams bsngo ba'i smin lam gdab /
analyzed: de nas kun gyis gzungs kyi snying po logs shig tu phyung ba bzhi bcu rtsa dgu man chad bdun yan chad ci nus su bklag / de'i rjes la spyi la mchod pa lan cig byas nas bsod nams bsngo ba'i smin lam gdab /
translated: After that, make offerings to the general mandala once and recite the aspiration prayer of merit dedication.

original: de nas bzod par gsol te slar gshegs pa'i tshogs bcad bklag ste gyes /
analyzed: de nas bzod par gsol te slar gshegs pa'i tshogs bcad bklag ste gyes /
translated: Then request forbearance and recite the section on the departure of the assembly and dismiss the mandala.

original: mchod pa bshams pa'i thabs 'byor pa'i stobs kyis ci nus pa dang sbyar te ;🔽mandal chen po'i steng du tshon phye'am /
analyzed: mchod pa bshams pa'i thabs 'byor pa'i stobs kyis ci nus pa dang sbyar te ; mandal chen po'i steng du tshon phye'am /
translated: The method of arranging the offerings is to do as much as possible according to the power of your resources.

original: me tog las rin po che sna lnga'i pho brang rta babs dang / mu tig gi phreng ba dang / rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: me tog las rin po che sna lnga'i pho brang rta babs dang / mu tig gi phreng ba dang / rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa /
translated: On top of the large mandala, arrange a palace of the five precious substances with archways, pearl garlands and various ornaments made from colored sand or flowers.

original: gzhi padma'i gdan dang bcas pa bris pa snam bu bar ma gzhal med khang gi gung la aan 'tsham pa'i seng ge'i khri dang sbyar te /
analyzed: gzhi padma'i gdan dang bcas pa bris pa snam bu bar ma gzhal med khang gi gung la aan 'tsham pa'i seng ge'i khri dang sbyar te /
translated: The base and lotus seat are drawn on the inner cloth. The inner cloth is attached to the center of the celestial mansion.🔽

original: tshon @247b sna lnga'i tshas kyis dkris pa'i mdo sde'i pu sti dang / de bzhin gshegs pa brgyad kyi sku gzugs bzhugs /
analyzed: tshon @247b sna lnga'i tshas kyis dkris pa'i mdo sde'i pu sti dang / de bzhin gshegs pa brgyad kyi sku gzugs bzhugs /
translated: Draw the base and lotus seat. Place the sutra basket wrapped in five-colored cloth and the statues of the eight tathagatas on the lion throne in the center of the celestial mansion of the intermediate space.

original: g-yas g-yon du'ang aan khri 'tsham pa bzhag la /
analyzed: g-yas g-yon du'ang aan khri 'tsham pa bzhag la /
translated: Place the lion thrones on the right and left.

original: g-yas g-yon gyi gral stod du ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'khor byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs par bsham ;
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi gral stod du ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'khor byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs par bsham ;
translated: Arrange the bodhisattvas, the retinue of the tathagatas, in the upper rows on the right and left.

original: g-yas gral smad du ni lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / phyogs skyong ba bcu dang / dam pa'i chos skyong ba thams cad bzhugs su gsol /
analyzed: g-yas gral smad du ni lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / phyogs skyong ba bcu dang / dam pa'i chos skyong ba thams cad bzhugs su gsol /
translated: Invite the lord of gods Indra, the four great kings, the ten direction protectors and all Dharma protectors to the lower rows on the right.

original: g-yon gral smad du ni gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon bcu gnyis bzhugs par bsham /
analyzed: g-yon gral smad du ni gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon bcu gnyis bzhugs par bsham /
translated: Arrange the twelve yaksha generals in the lower rows on the left.

original: shar phyogs kyi ngos su aan chung du'am /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi ngos su aan chung du'am /
translated: On the eastern side, arrange a small lion throne.

original: gzhong bu'am man 'ji las gzhi blangs pa'i steng du /
analyzed: gzhong bu'am man 'ji las gzhi blangs pa'i steng du /
translated: On the base of a bowl or a tray,🔽one should set up a seat for the Noble Manjusri, Vajrapani, and Avalokitesvara, as if they were present in the manner of performing the deeds that arise from the meaning of the sutra, invoking their former commitments.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / skyabs grol gdan 'dzom pa la sngon gyi thugs dam bskul zhing mdo sde'i don las 'byung ba'i phrin las mdzad pa'i tshul du bzhugs pa ltar gdan bsham zhing so so'i sku gzugs kyang bzhugs par bya /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / skyabs grol gdan 'dzom pa la sngon gyi thugs dam bskul zhing mdo sde'i don las 'byung ba'i phrin las mdzad pa'i tshul du bzhugs pa ltar gdan bsham zhing so so'i sku gzugs kyang bzhugs par bya /
translated: One should also place the images of each of them.

original: lha bzhugs pa'i snam bu'i gzhi yang padmas 'khor bar bya /
analyzed: lha bzhugs pa'i snam bu'i gzhi yang padmas 'khor bar bya /
translated: The base of the cloth on which the deities are placed should be surrounded by lotuses.

original: dbus kyi padma la'am spyan sngar spreng ba /
analyzed: dbus kyi padma la'am spyan sngar spreng ba /
translated: In front of the lotus in the center, or in front of the image,🔽one should place nine vases for the dhâraî water, with beautiful and comfortable handles, together with their ornaments.

original: gar sdug cing bde bar gzungs chu'i bum pa kha rgyan dang bcas pa dgu gzhag / phyi rol gyi snam bu'i nang du bkra shis dang / shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i rgyan la 'os pa'i khol ma bkram li /
analyzed: gar sdug cing bde bar gzungs chu'i bum pa kha rgyan dang bcas pa dgu gzhag / phyi rol gyi snam bu'i nang du bkra shis dang / shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i rgyan la 'os pa'i khol ma bkram li /
translated: On the outer cloth, one should spread out auspicious things, trees, and so forth, which are suitable as ornaments.

original: phyi tshon sna lnga'i gzhal med khang sgo khyud dang / rta babs su bcas pa bri zhing mu tig gi phreng ba dang / do shal gyi khol ma bkod la /
analyzed: phyi tshon sna lnga'i gzhal med khang sgo khyud dang / rta babs su bcas pa bri zhing mu tig gi phreng ba dang / do shal gyi khol ma bkod la /
translated: Draw a celestial palace with five-colored outer walls, gateways, and pediments. Arrange garlands of pearls and necklaces.

original: de dag gi steng du lha bshos dang yon chab la sogs pa mchod pa rnams kyang dgram /🔽tshon gyis bri bar dka' na me tog dgram pa'am /
analyzed: de dag gi steng du lha bshos dang yon chab la sogs pa mchod pa rnams kyang dgram / tshon gyis bri bar dka' na me tog dgram pa'am /
translated: Above them, arrange offerings such as ritual cakes and water offerings.

original: mandal tsam bya /
analyzed: mandal tsam bya /
translated: If it is difficult to draw with colored powders, arrange flowers or just a mandala.

original: steng du yang bla re dang gdugs ci 'byor pas klu bas /
analyzed: steng du yang bla re dang gdugs ci 'byor pas klu bas /
translated: Above, arrange canopies and parasols as much as you can afford.

original: ngos su yang rgyal mtshan dang / chon sna lnga pa'i ba dan pa'i bzhi bcu rtsa dgu las lhag pa yan chad ci 'byor pa rgyas par dgram /
analyzed: ngos su yang rgyal mtshan dang / chon sna lnga pa'i ba dan pa'i bzhi bcu rtsa dgu las lhag pa yan chad ci 'byor pa rgyas par dgram /
translated: On the sides, arrange victory banners and forty-nine or more pennants of five-colored cloth as much as you can afford.

original: mar me'i kha grangs ni lnga bcu rtsa bzhi man chad du bya ste /
analyzed: mar me'i kha grangs ni lnga bcu rtsa bzhi man chad du bya ste /
translated: The number of butter lamps should be at least fifty-four.

original: de las kha grangs dgu yan chad ci nus pa nyin mtshan du bar ma chad par gtang /
analyzed: de las kha grangs dgu yan chad ci nus pa nyin mtshan du bar ma chad par gtang /
translated: More than that, as many as you can afford, should be lit continuously day and night.

original: lha bshos ni de bzhin gshegs pa brgyad la cha re re /
analyzed: lha bshos ni de bzhin gshegs pa brgyad la cha re re /
translated: For the ritual cakes, there should be one for each of the eight tathagatas.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / skyabs grel la @248a * //🔽cha re re /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / skyabs grel la @248a * // cha re re /
translated: Vajrapani,

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang rgyal po chen po bzhi la cha re re /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang rgyal po chen po bzhi la cha re re /
translated: and the four great kings each receive a portion.🔽The thirty-two gods of the desire and form realms, the eight great nagas, the four great kings, the thirty-three gods, the thirty-two yaksha generals, and the Dharma protectors in general each receive a portion.🔽Two portions are for the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos skyong ba spyi la cha gcig / chos gnyis la cha re re /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos skyong ba spyi la cha gcig / chos gnyis la cha re re /
translated: Two portions are for the Dharma.

original: gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon bcu gnyis la cha re re /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon bcu gnyis la cha re re /
translated: Twelve portions are for the twelve yaksha generals.

original: spyi gtor chen po gcig 'di rnams so so'i spyan sngar gar 'os par dbab ;
analyzed: spyi gtor chen po gcig 'di rnams so so'i spyan sngar gar 'os par dbab ;
translated: One great general offering is for all of them.🔽On the two sides, read the sutra of the seven tathagatas' aspirations continuously day and night in shifts.

original: ngos gnyis su de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi smon lam gyi mdo sde nyin mtshan du bar ma chad par thun du bklag / chos kyi sbyin pa dbul ba mdo sde grva gcig gdan khri bshams te ci nus su bklag / mchod pa bshams pa'i mdun du mchod
analyzed: ngos gnyis su de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi smon lam gyi mdo sde nyin mtshan du bar ma chad par thun du bklag / chos kyi sbyin pa dbul ba mdo sde grva gcig gdan khri bshams te ci nus su bklag / mchod pa bshams pa'i mdun du mchod
translated: Make offerings of Dharma by arranging a seat in a corner of the sutra and reading it as much as possible.

original: pa la 'du ba rnams kyi stan bshams te /
analyzed: pa la 'du ba rnams kyi stan bshams te /
translated: In front of the arranged offerings, set up seats for the assembly.

original: mdun mdun du mchod pa rnam pa lnga dbul ba legs par bshams la /
analyzed: mdun mdun du mchod pa rnam pa lnga dbul ba legs par bshams la /
translated: In front of each, offer the five types of offerings well arranged.

original: rol mo dang sil snyan byed pa'i grva gcig kyang zla ba bstar te phyed du gzhug / mchod pa bshams pa ni mdor na tshad nges pa med de //
analyzed: rol mo dang sil snyan byed pa'i grva gcig kyang zla ba bstar te phyed du gzhug / mchod pa bshams pa ni mdor na tshad nges pa med de //
translated: As for the arrangement of offerings, in brief there is no fixed measure.

original: bde ba can gyi zhing gi yon tan gyi bkod pa dang mthun par nus kyang rung /
analyzed: bde ba can gyi zhing gi yon tan gyi bkod pa dang mthun par nus kyang rung /
translated: If one is able, one should make it accord with the array of good qualities of the field of Sukhāvatī.

original: tha ma mandal byas te /
analyzed: tha ma mandal byas te /
translated: At the very least, one should make a maṇḍala.

original: me tog chu phor gang tsam gyis mchod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: me tog chu phor gang tsam gyis mchod kyang rung ste /
translated: Even if one makes offerings with just a handful of flowers and water,

original: rang gi 'byor pa'i nyams kyis ci lcogs su 'bad de bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'byor pa'i nyams kyis ci lcogs su 'bad de bya'o //
translated: one should strive to do whatever one can according to one’s own resources.

original: yid kyi mchod pa ni ci nas kyang rgya che zhing bzang bar bsam zhing bden pa bdar te /
analyzed: yid kyi mchod pa ni ci nas kyang rgya che zhing bzang bar bsam zhing bden pa bdar te /
translated: As for mental offerings, one should imagine them to be vast and excellent in every way, and recite the truth.

original: smon lam yang gdab /
analyzed: smon lam yang gdab /
translated: One should also make aspirations.

original: lha bshos kyi cha dang ; mar me'i grangs kyang mi 'byor na nyung du bsdur yang rung /
analyzed: lha bshos kyi cha dang ; mar me'i grangs kyang mi 'byor na nyung du bsdur yang rung /
translated: If one cannot afford the portions of the bali cake and the number of lamps, one may reduce them.

original: 'byor na ci 'os pa mang du bskyed kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: 'byor na ci 'os pa mang du bskyed kyang rung ngo //
translated: If one can afford it, one may increase them as much as one likes.

original: dang po mdo sde las 'byung ba'i cho ga bzhin du /
analyzed: dang po mdo sde las 'byung ba'i cho ga bzhin du /
translated: First, according to the ritual that appears in the sūtras,

original: sems can thams cad la byams pa dang snying rjes khyab par bsgom mo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pa dang snying rjes khyab par bsgom mo //
translated: Meditate on being pervaded by love and compassion for all sentient beings.

original: mchod pa bshams te /
analyzed: mchod pa bshams te /
translated: Arrange the offerings.

original: dge 'dun tshogs nas phyogs bcu'i 'phags pa thams cad la phyag bya /
analyzed: dge 'dun tshogs nas phyogs bcu'i 'phags pa thams cad la phyag bya /
translated: Having gathered the saṅgha, prostrate to all the noble ones in the ten directions.

original: de nas rig pa'i tshul gang la goms pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad dmigs su med par stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ci ran cig bsgom mo //
analyzed: de nas rig pa'i tshul gang la goms pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad dmigs su med par stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ci ran cig bsgom mo //
translated: Then, through the method of awareness, meditate for as long as you like on the samādhi of emptiness, the nonobservation of all phenomena.

original: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin las langs nas 'di snyam du chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i don de lta bu yin la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin las langs nas 'di snyam du chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i don de lta bu yin la /
translated: After that, having arisen from samādhi, think, “The meaning of the nonobservation of all phenomena is like that.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid thugs su chud pas sku dang gsung dang thugs nam mkha' dang 'dra bar gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid thugs su chud pas sku dang gsung dang thugs nam mkha' dang 'dra bar gyur te /
translated: Since the noble ones have realized thatness, their body, speech, and mind have become like space.

original: sgrib pa mi mnga' zhing mthu dang / byin gyi rlabs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i go 'phang brnyes par yang rung na /
analyzed: sgrib pa mi mnga' zhing mthu dang / byin gyi rlabs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i go 'phang brnyes par yang rung na /
translated: They have attained the state of being free of obscurations and of inconceivable power and blessings.

original: kye ma sems @248b can 'di rnams chos kyi de kho na nyid ma rtogs te /
analyzed: kye ma sems @248b can 'di rnams chos kyi de kho na nyid ma rtogs te /
translated: Alas! These sentient beings have not realized the thatness of phenomena.

original: rmongs pas nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal mang pos gzir te /
analyzed: rmongs pas nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal mang pos gzir te /
translated: They are tormented by many afflictions and sufferings due to their ignorance.

original: nyam thag pa'i gnas su lhung bar gyur la /
analyzed: nyam thag pa'i gnas su lhung bar gyur la /
translated: They have fallen into a state of distress.

original: sems can thams cad kyang thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas 'gro ba brgyud pa rnams su bdag gi bshes gnyen dam pa drin gyi zhing du ma gyur pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas 'gro ba brgyud pa rnams su bdag gi bshes gnyen dam pa drin gyi zhing du ma gyur pa 'ga' yang med de /
translated: Moreover, in the course of beginningless cyclic existence, there is not a single being who has not been a close friend or relative of mine in the course of my wandering in samsara.

original: bdag gis kyang dang po byang chub kyi sems dam pa bskyed de /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang dang po byang chub kyi sems dam pa bskyed de /
translated: I have generated the excellent mind of enlightenment and

original: 'gro ba mang po'i phan pa dang bde ba'i don dpag tu med pa bsgrub par dam bcas pa'i dus kyi tshe /
analyzed: 'gro ba mang po'i phan pa dang bde ba'i don dpag tu med pa bsgrub par dam bcas pa'i dus kyi tshe /
translated: have promised to accomplish the benefit and happiness of many beings.🔽At that time, I have already taken all sentient beings as my own.

original: sems can thams cad bdag gir blangs zin pas 'di lta bu la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yal bar 'dor ba ni mi rigs na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag gir blangs zin pas 'di lta bu la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yal bar 'dor ba ni mi rigs na /
translated: If it is not right for the bodhisattvas to abandon such beings,

original: 'di dag ji ltar sdug bsngal las ni gdon /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar sdug bsngal las ni gdon /
translated: how can I possibly abandon them?

original: bde ba la ni dgod par bya snyam du snying rje dang / byams pa chen po dang ldan pa'i brtson pa'i sems drag tu bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba la ni dgod par bya snyam du snying rje dang / byams pa chen po dang ldan pa'i brtson pa'i sems drag tu bskyed par bya'o //
translated: With this thought, one should generate a fierce intention endowed with great compassion and love.

original: yang 'di snyam du bsams te /
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du bsams te /
translated: Again, one should think as follows:

original: bdag ni dus ngan pa'i sems can spyod pa dang mthu dman pa yin pas /
analyzed: bdag ni dus ngan pa'i sems can spyod pa dang mthu dman pa yin pas /
translated: “I am a being of degenerate times, with inferior conduct and abilities.

original: bdag nyid gcig pus 'phral du don rlabs po che 'di lta bu ni mi lcogs kyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig pus 'phral du don rlabs po che 'di lta bu ni mi lcogs kyi /
translated: I am incapable of such a great task all by myself, right now.

original: ston pa bde bar gshegs pas sngon ci ltar phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya pa tha ma la dam pa'i chos 'grib pa na sems can thams cad rjes su gzung ba'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi thabs mkhas pa dang sngon gyi smon lam gyi khyad par
analyzed: ston pa bde bar gshegs pas sngon ci ltar phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya pa tha ma la dam pa'i chos 'grib pa na sems can thams cad rjes su gzung ba'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi thabs mkhas pa dang sngon gyi smon lam gyi khyad par
translated: The Sugata, the Teacher, in the past, during the final five hundred years, when the true Dharma was declining, in order to care for all sentient beings, taught the skillful means and the special former aspirations of the seven tathagatas.

original: rgyas pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad gsungs pa las byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyas pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad gsungs pa las byung ba bzhin du /
translated: In accordance with what has come forth from the Bhagavat’s extensive teachings,

original: bcom ldan 'das sman gyi bla bee d'urya 'od kyi rgyal po la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa bdun la mthu brtan dpung gnyen du gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sman gyi bla bee d'urya 'od kyi rgyal po la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa bdun la mthu brtan dpung gnyen du gsol te /
translated: The Blessed One, the seven thus-gone ones beginning with the medicine buddha Vaiduryaprabharāja, and so forth, are requested to be the firm support of power.

original: da ltar ni 'phags pa rnams kyi mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis /
analyzed: da ltar ni 'phags pa rnams kyi mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis /
translated: Now, by the power and blessings of the noble ones,

original: 'gro ba rnams la phan pa bsgrub par bya la /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams la phan pa bsgrub par bya la /
translated: I will accomplish the benefit of beings.

original: phyis ni bdag nyid gcig pus gzhan la ltos pa med par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bla na med pa bsgrub par bya'o snyam du bsam mo //
analyzed: phyis ni bdag nyid gcig pus gzhan la ltos pa med par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bla na med pa bsgrub par bya'o snyam du bsam mo //
translated: Later, by myself alone, without relying on others, I will accomplish the unsurpassed benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: snying rje dang byams pa'i sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: snying rje dang byams pa'i sems bskyed pa'i 'og tu /
translated: After generating the mind of compassion and love,

original: sems can gyi don bya bar brtsam pa'i phyir 'phags pa gdan 'dzom pa'i pho brang dang / mchod pa'i tshogs bshams shing bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i yid kyis bden pa bdar zhing yid kyas @249a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya bar brtsam pa'i phyir 'phags pa gdan 'dzom pa'i pho brang dang / mchod pa'i tshogs bshams shing bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i yid kyis bden pa bdar zhing yid kyas @249a * //
translated: in order to commence benefiting sentient beings, one should arrange the assembly hall of the noble ones and the collection of offerings, and with a completely pure mind, recite the ascertainment of truth with the mind.

original: bsngo ba / dkon mchog gsum gyi bden pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis byin gyi rlabs dang / tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i mnga' thang chen po dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i stobs dang / bcom ldan 'das sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa bdun dang /
analyzed: bsngo ba / dkon mchog gsum gyi bden pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis byin gyi rlabs dang / tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i mnga' thang chen po dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i stobs dang / bcom ldan 'das sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa bdun dang /
translated: The truth of the Three Jewels, the blessings of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the great power of the perfection of the two accumulations, the strength of the pure realm of phenomena, the seven thus-gone ones, such as the blessed medicine buddha, the king of the blue beryl light,

original: ston pa bde bar gshegs pa dpal sh'akya thub pa 'khor dang bcas pa gdan 'dzom pa'i pho brang gi dkyil 'khor dang / mchod pa'i tshogs sbyar ba 'di rnams /
analyzed: ston pa bde bar gshegs pa dpal sh'akya thub pa 'khor dang bcas pa gdan 'dzom pa'i pho brang gi dkyil 'khor dang / mchod pa'i tshogs sbyar ba 'di rnams /
translated: and the teacher, the sugata, the glorious Shakyamuni, together with his retinue, in the mandala of the palace where they are gathered, and these offerings that are presented,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi sngon gyi smon lam khyad par can gyis bsgrubs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med kyi zhing gi bkod pa'i yon tan lta bu dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi sngon gyi smon lam khyad par can gyis bsgrubs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med kyi zhing gi bkod pa'i yon tan lta bu dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva will come to possess a pure buddha realm that is established by the extraordinary aspirations of the thus-gone ones and is endowed with the qualities of the array of the blessed Amitābha’s realm.

original: sa gzhi rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin lag mthil ltar mnyam pa ;
analyzed: sa gzhi rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin lag mthil ltar mnyam pa ;
translated: The ground will be made of various precious substances, smooth like the palm of the hand,

original: tha gru che ba yangs pa /
analyzed: tha gru che ba yangs pa /
translated: vast, and expansive.

original: reg na 'jam zhing ba de ba dang / dri ma med cing 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: reg na 'jam zhing ba de ba dang / dri ma med cing 'od gsal ba /
translated: It will be soft to the touch, immaculate, and radiant.

original: tsandan sprul gyi snying po'i dri bsung dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tsandan sprul gyi snying po'i dri bsung dang ldan pa /
translated: It will have the fragrance of uragasāra sandalwood.

original: lha'i me tog sna tshogs kyis gcal bkram pa /
analyzed: lha'i me tog sna tshogs kyis gcal bkram pa /
translated: It will be strewn with various divine flowers.

original: mtha' rin po che'i pha gus brtsigs shing gser dang mu tig gi gram bu dang bye ma bdal ba dang / autpa la dang / ku mu ta dang / padma 'gying zhing ldem pas khebs par gyur cig / chu bya sna tshogs skad snyan pa sgrogs pa dga' la 'phyo zhing lding bas brgyan pa'i yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i mtsho dang rdzing dang lteng ka dag gis mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: mtha' rin po che'i pha gus brtsigs shing gser dang mu tig gi gram bu dang bye ma bdal ba dang / autpa la dang / ku mu ta dang / padma 'gying zhing ldem pas khebs par gyur cig / chu bya sna tshogs skad snyan pa sgrogs pa dga' la 'phyo zhing lding bas brgyan pa'i yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i mtsho dang rdzing dang lteng ka dag gis mdzes par byas pa /
translated: May it be beautified with jeweled lotus ponds, filled with water endowed with the eight qualities, covered with blue, pink, and white lotuses in full and fragrant bloom, and adorned with various water birds sweetly singing and gracefully swimming and diving.

original: rin po che'i dpag bsam gyi shing ljon pa lha'i nor bu dang / mu tig gi rgyan phreng dang / rin po che dbyangs pa //🔽me tog gi mgo lcogs dang / 'bras bus mdzes par chags pas g-yur za zhing ldem la /
analyzed: rin po che'i dpag bsam gyi shing ljon pa lha'i nor bu dang / mu tig gi rgyan phreng dang / rin po che dbyangs pa //🔽me tog gi mgo lcogs dang / 'bras bus mdzes par chags pas g-yur za zhing ldem la /
translated: May it be beautified with jeweled wish-fulfilling trees, with divine jewel and pearl ornaments, and with jeweled bells.🔽May it be beautified with jeweled lotus ponds, filled with water endowed with the eight qualities, covered with blue, pink, and white lotuses in full and fragrant bloom, and adorned with various water birds sweetly singing and gracefully swimming and diving.

original: gser gyi dril bu g-yer kha 'khros ba la dam pa'i chos kyi sgra 'byung ba dang ldan pa tshar du sbrengs pas legs par brgyan pa'i sa gzhi la gzhal med khang chen po /
analyzed: gser gyi dril bu g-yer kha 'khros ba la dam pa'i chos kyi sgra 'byung ba dang ldan pa tshar du sbrengs pas legs par brgyan pa'i sa gzhi la gzhal med khang chen po /
translated: The ground is well adorned with a series of golden bells and small bells that emit the sound of the holy Dharma.

original: rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar bar bkod pa /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar bar bkod pa /
translated: The great celestial mansion is arrayed with the seven precious substances blazing in the best way.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med par rgyas par 'od zer chen po rab tu 'byung ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med par rgyas par 'od zer chen po rab tu 'byung ba /
translated: It is filled with great light rays that extend throughout immeasurable world systems.

original: gnas tha dad pa shin tu rnam par phye ba mtha' yas par rnam par gnas pa /
analyzed: gnas tha dad pa shin tu rnam par phye ba mtha' yas par rnam par gnas pa /
translated: It is arranged with an infinite number of distinct places that are well differentiated.

original: @249b rgya yongs su ma chad pa khams gsum las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul /
analyzed: @249b rgya yongs su ma chad pa khams gsum las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul /
translated: It is not limited in any way and is the domain that transcends the three realms.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur pa'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang sgyur pa'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: It is beyond the world and arises from the roots of virtue that are its superior good qualities. It is characterized by the pure, sovereign consciousness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas /
translated: It is the abode of the tathagatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa'i dge 'dun dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa'i dge 'dun dang ldan pa /
translated: It is endowed with an assembly of bodhisattvas beyond number.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa mtha' yas pa rnam par rgyu ba /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa mtha' yas pa rnam par rgyu ba /
translated: It was frequented by countless gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans.

original: chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos brten pa /
analyzed: chos kyi ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba chen pos brten pa /
translated: It was sustained by the great joy and bliss of the taste of the Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad yang dag par thob par byed pa /🔽nye bar gnas pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad yang dag par thob par byed pa / nye bar gnas pa /
translated: It was the means by which all the aims of all beings were perfectly accomplished.🔽It was the place where all the buddhas of the three times had attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: It was free from all the harm of the stains of the afflictions.

original: bdud thams cad yongs su spangs pa //
analyzed: bdud thams cad yongs su spangs pa //
translated: It was the place where all māras were abandoned.

original: thams cad kyi bkod pa las lhag pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyi bkod pa las lhag pa /
translated: It was superior to all arrays.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa'i gnas dran pa dang blo gros dang / rtogs pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa'i gnas dran pa dang blo gros dang / rtogs pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba /
translated: It was the place of the array of the tathāgatas, which arose from great mindfulness, understanding, and realization.

original: zhi gan dang lhag mthong chen po'i bzhon pa yin pa /
analyzed: zhi gan dang lhag mthong chen po'i bzhon pa yin pa /
translated: It was the vehicle of great tranquility and insight.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa nas 'jug pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa nas 'jug pa /
translated: The great doors of liberation are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po'i yon tan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa'i bkod pa la brten pa'i gzhal med khang chen por gyur pa'i nang du /
analyzed: rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po'i yon tan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa'i bkod pa la brten pa'i gzhal med khang chen por gyur pa'i nang du /
translated: In the great palace that is based on the array of the king of precious lotuses, which is adorned with infinite qualities,🔽in the center there are eight precious lion thrones for the eight tathāgatas, which are covered with divine silk and calico, and are endowed with a lion banner.

original: gung la de bzhin gshegs pa brgyad bzhugs par 'os pa'i rin po che'i seng ge'i gdan khri lha'i der zab dang ras bcos bus g-yogs pa ne ma zhing 'phar ba'i rlong dang ldan pa'i sku rten dang bcas pa brgyad 'byung zhing g-yas g-yon du yang 'khor gyi gtso
analyzed: gung la de bzhin gshegs pa brgyad bzhugs par 'os pa'i rin po che'i seng ge'i gdan khri lha'i der zab dang ras bcos bus g-yogs pa ne ma zhing 'phar ba'i rlong dang ldan pa'i sku rten dang bcas pa brgyad 'byung zhing g-yas g-yon du yang 'khor gyi gtso
translated: On the right and left are the principal retinue,

original: bo byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / chos skyong thugs dam can bzhugs pa'i padma'i gdan brgya stong mang po dang / mdun gyi ngos su 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / skyabs grol bzhugs pa'i padma'i gdan bzang po 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: bo byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / chos skyong thugs dam can bzhugs pa'i padma'i gdan brgya stong mang po dang / mdun gyi ngos su 'phags pa 'jam dpal dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / skyabs grol bzhugs pa'i padma'i gdan bzang po 'byung ba dang /
translated: In front of them are excellent lotus seats for the noble Mañjuśrī, Vajrapāṇi, and Avalokiteśvara.

original: phyi nang thams cad cha rigs dang 'tsham pa mi dang / lha'i yo byad dam pa zhal zas dang / na bza' dang / rgyan dang / rol mo la sogs pa phul du phyin pa sna tshogs phung po gsum pa'i mdo dang / bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam las 'byung ba rgya mtsho thams cad @250a * //
analyzed: phyi nang thams cad cha rigs dang 'tsham pa mi dang / lha'i yo byad dam pa zhal zas dang / na bza' dang / rgyan dang / rol mo la sogs pa phul du phyin pa sna tshogs phung po gsum pa'i mdo dang / bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam las 'byung ba rgya mtsho thams cad @250a * //
translated: The entire space is filled with the finest human and divine offerings—food, clothing, ornaments, music, and so on—as described in the sūtra of the Three Heaps and the Prayer of Excellent Conduct.

original: kyis rgyas par gang zhing rgyan klubs pa dang ldan par gyur cig /'phags pa gdan 'dzom pas kyang /
analyzed: kyis rgyas par gang zhing rgyan klubs pa dang ldan par gyur cig /'phags pa gdan 'dzom pas kyang /
translated: May all the oceans of offerings be filled and adorn the place.🔽May the noble ones assembled there🔽bless and accept the offerings.

analyzed: dbul ba / sdug bsngal ba /

translated: who experience painful sensations day and night from cold, heat, flies, and mosquitoes, all be provided with various clothes, precious ornaments, necklaces,🔽perfumes, and various musical sounds. May all their wishes be fulfilled.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi gnod pas mi brdzi bar rnam par grol ba'i bde ba la gnas par gyur cig /'di nas shi 'phos nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du padma'i snying po'i seng ge'i khri la rdzus te skye zhing / skyes ma thag tu gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin la @262a * //

translated: May they receive the perfect transmission of the teachings and please the minds of the buddhas. May they be able to enter all the buddhafields without hindrance.

analyzed: ser snas zil gyis non pa'i dbang gis yi dags sam /

original: skye bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad mi'i 'jig rten du skye zhing tshe rabs dran pa dang / ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pas skrag nas 'dod pa'i yon tan don du mi gnyer ba dang / sbyin pa la dga' ba dang / sbyin pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang /

translated: May they be frightened by the terrors of the lower realms and not pursue the objects of desire. May they delight in generosity and praise the practice of giving.

analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su btang ste /🔽nor gyi phung po gzhan lta ci smos te /

translated: May those sentient beings, ourselves and others, who have a distorted understanding of the trainings of the Tathagata🔽and who,

analyzed: tshul khrims tsam srung gi / mang du thos pa yongs su mi tshol ba rnams dang / mang du thos pa mdo sde rnams kyi don zab mo mi shes shing lhag pa'i nga rgyal can du gyur pa /
translated: and who, though they have extensive learning, do not understand the profound meaning of the sutras and become arrogant,

analyzed: gzhan dag la phrag dog byed cing / dam pa'i chos la dbang za zhing spong ba'i dbang gis sems can dmyal ba mi bzad par ltung pa'am /

analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad ngan 'gro'i gnas nas thar la /

translated: and then, even after they escape that, become animals such as cows, horses, camels, and donkeys, beaten with sticks and whips, tormented by hunger and thirst, and oppressed by heavy loads, and even if they are born as humans, always be born into a low caste,

translated: May they be completely free from mental dissatisfaction and conflict.

analyzed: 'byung po tha dad pa dag 'gugs par byed pa /

translated: May all those sentient beings, ourselves and others, who aspire to be born in the Sukhāvatī world where the Tathāgata Amitāyus resides, be taught the path by the eight bodhisattvas who miraculously arrive at the time of death, and may they be miraculously born in Sukhāvatī.🔽Those who are born as gods there

translated: When they die and pass from this world, may they be reborn in the human realm as universal monarchs, rulers over the four continents.🔽May they establish many hundreds of thousands of sentient beings in the ten virtuous actions.🔽Otherwise, may they be born in the households of the royal class, the priestly class, or the householder class, in households as wealthy as the great sāla trees, with abundant wealth,

analyzed: bdag cag la sogs pa sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis dgongs par gyur cig / rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad kyis yang dag par bsrung bar gyur cig / lha dang brgya byin dang / tshangs pa thams cad dang /
translated: May we be cared for by all the gods, Indra, Brahma,🔽and the four great kings.🔽May all our karmic obscurations, such as the five heinous acts, be purified.🔽May we never be afflicted by any illness.

translated: May all the dangers of death, enemies, and wilderness, as well as all quarrels, disputes, and wars, be completely pacified.🔽May they not fall under the power of any enemy.🔽May all their wishes and aspirations be fulfilled.

analyzed: gang smon pa'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / ston pa bcom ldan 'das dpal sh'akya thub pa nas bzung ste /

analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon bcu gnyis kyi bar du phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa snga ma bzhin du byas la so sor zhal gyis bzhes pa dang / thugs dam bcas pa bzhin du gsol ba gdab par bya'o //

analyzed: nad sna tshogs kyis gzir ba /

analyzed: phongs par gyur pa thams cad rjes su bzung zheng lha dang mi rnams kyi don dang / sman pa dang bde ba'i slad du /
translated: and for the benefit, healing, and happiness of gods and humans,

original: bklag par bya /

analyzed: re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /

analyzed: gus par gzung zhing dad par bya /

original: sku gzugs bya /

analyzed: sa phyogs gtsang mar byas shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing der skye bar smon lam gdab /

analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che dang zla ba dang padmas rab tu brgyan pa mkhas pa gzi brjid sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po des dgongs par 'gyur /

analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas kyang sdig pa thams cad zad par 'gyur nas /
translated: After they die, all their negative actions will be exhausted,

translated: and they will be reborn miraculously on a lion throne in the heart of a lotus in the buddha realm of the thus-gone Precious Moon and Lotus Adorned Skillful Melodious King. As soon as they are born, they will attain the samādhi called

translated: And he also said, “Friends, if you recite the name of the thus-gone one Golden Splendor Immaculate Jewel Light, who has accomplished disciplined conduct, and these dhāraṇī verses three times a day and three times a night, with a compassionate mind toward all beings, making offerings with flowers and so forth,

analyzed: gtsang mar byas nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang ldan par byas na /

translated: He also said, “Those who hear the name of the tathagata Dharmamegha­svara, who hold it, who have faith in it, and who make offerings to it with great respect, will be purified of all their negative actions and will not turn back from the enlightenment of the buddhas.

translated: Wherever they are born, as soon as they think of it, they will be endowed with clothes, ornaments, incense, garlands, bedding, medicine for illness, necessities, enjoyments, and power.”🔽He also said:

original: 'jam dpal so so'i skye bo gang dag dge ba dang mi dge ba mi shes pa dag yod de /
analyzed: 'jam dpal so so'i skye bo gang dag dge ba dang mi dge ba mi shes pa dag yod de /
translated: Mañjuśrī, there are ordinary beings who do not know what is virtuous and what is not virtuous.

original: de dag ni chags bas zil gyis non cing /
analyzed: de dag ni chags bas zil gyis non cing /
translated: They are overcome by attachment.

original: sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu mi shes te /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu mi shes te /
translated: They do not know generosity or the results of generosity.

original: nor sog cing bsrung ba la brtson gyi sbyin pa yang dag par 'gyed pa la sems mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: nor sog cing bsrung ba la brtson gyi sbyin pa yang dag par 'gyed pa la sems mi 'gro ste /
translated: They strive to accumulate and guard wealth, but their minds do not turn to the perfect giving of gifts.

original: sbyin pa'i dus nye bar gnas pa na rang gi lus kyi sha las bcad pa bzhin du yid mi dga' bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dus nye bar gnas pa na rang gi lus kyi sha las bcad pa bzhin du yid mi dga' bar 'gyur ba /
translated: When the time comes to give, they are as unhappy as if they were cutting flesh from their own bodies.

original: bdag nyid kyang du ma yongs su mi sbyod na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang du ma yongs su mi sbyod na /
translated: If they do not even share with themselves,

original: pha ma dang / bu smad dang / g-yog 'khor la ltag la ster /
analyzed: pha ma dang / bu smad dang / g-yog 'khor la ltag la ster /
translated: how much less so with their parents, children, spouses, and servants.

original: gzhan slong ba rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'i sems can de lta bu dag ni shi 'phos nas yi dags sam dud 'gror skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan slong ba rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'i sems can de lta bu dag ni shi 'phos nas yi dags sam dud 'gror skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When such beings die, they are reborn as hungry ghosts or animals.

original: de la gang dag sngon mir gyur pa na de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan thos pa de dag ni yi dags sam /
analyzed: de la gang dag sngon mir gyur pa na de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan thos pa de dag ni yi dags sam /
translated: Those who, when they were human, heard the name of the Tathāgata King of Physicians Lapis Lazuli Radiance, whether as hungry ghosts or animals,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas gang yang rung ba der de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan mngon du 'gyur zhing dran ma thag pa tsam gyis tshe 'phos nas kyang mi'i 'jig rten du skye zhing tsha rabs dran par 'gyur /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas gang yang rung ba der de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan mngon du 'gyur zhing dran ma thag pa tsam gyis tshe 'phos nas kyang mi'i 'jig rten du skye zhing tsha rabs dran par 'gyur /
translated: will be reborn in the human world as soon as they die, and will remember their previous lives.

original: ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pas skrag nas 'dod pa'i yon tan don du mi gnyer ba dang / sbyin pa la dga' ba dang / sbyin pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pas skrag nas 'dod pa'i yon tan don du mi gnyer ba dang / sbyin pa la dga' ba dang / sbyin pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtor bar 'gyur /
translated: They will delight in generosity, praise generosity, and give away all their possessions.

original: rim gyis rang gi mgo dang yan lag dang / sha khrag kyang slong ba rnams la rab tu sbyin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rim gyis rang gi mgo dang yan lag dang / sha khrag kyang slong ba rnams la rab tu sbyin par 'gyur na /
translated: If they are able to give away their own heads, limbs, flesh, and blood to those who ask for them,

original: nor gyi phung po gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: nor gyi phung po gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to mention other heaps of wealth?

original: 'jam dpal gzhan yang sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bslab pa'i gnas log par 'dzin pa dag yod de /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhan yang sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bslab pa'i gnas log par 'dzin pa dag yod de /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, moreover, there are sentient beings who misapprehend the points of training of the thus-gone ones.

original: gang dag tshul khrims dang ldan pa de dag ni tshul khrims tsam srung gi mang du thos pa yongs su mi tshol /
analyzed: gang dag tshul khrims dang ldan pa de dag ni tshul khrims tsam srung gi mang du thos pa yongs su mi tshol /
translated: Those who are endowed with discipline only guard that discipline and do not seek extensive learning.

original: mang du thos pa dag @266a * //
analyzed: mang du thos pa dag @266a * //
translated: Those who are extensively learned

original: ni mdo sde rnams kyi don zab mo mi shes shing lhag pa'i nga rgyal can du gyur te /
analyzed: ni mdo sde rnams kyi don zab mo mi shes shing lhag pa'i nga rgyal can du gyur te /
translated: do not understand the profound meaning of the sūtras and become arrogant.

original: gzhan dag la phrag dog byed cing dam pa'i chos la dbang za zhing spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la phrag dog byed cing dam pa'i chos la dbang za zhing spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be jealous of others and will despise and abandon the holy Dharma.

original: mi blun po bdud kyi phyogs rang yang lam ngan par zhugs la /
analyzed: mi blun po bdud kyi phyogs rang yang lam ngan par zhugs la /
translated: Those foolish people, who are on the side of Māra, will themselves enter the wrong path,

original: gzhan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma dag kyang g-yang sa chen por ltung bar byed pa de lta bu de dag ni sems can dmyal ba mi bzad par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma dag kyang g-yang sa chen por ltung bar byed pa de lta bu de dag ni sems can dmyal ba mi bzad par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will cause many hundred sextillions of other beings to fall into the great abyss. They will go to the unbearable hells.

original: gang dag sngon de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po'i mtshan thos pa de dag ni sems can dmyal ba'i gnas der /
analyzed: gang dag sngon de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po'i mtshan thos pa de dag ni sems can dmyal ba'i gnas der /
translated: But those who have previously heard the name of the thus-gone one King of Medicine Lapis Lazuli Radiance will, in that hell realm,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: encounter the name of the thus-gone one King of Medicine Lapis Lazuli Radiance.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas kyang mi'i 'jig rten du skye zhing yang dag pa'i lta ba can dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas kyang mi'i 'jig rten du skye zhing yang dag pa'i lta ba can dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa can du 'gyur //
translated: After they die and transmigrate, they will be reborn in the human world, with right view, diligence, and virtuous intentions.

original: byim spangs nas sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas /
analyzed: byim spangs nas sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas /
translated: Having abandoned that, he will go forth in the teachings of the Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will practice the conduct of a bodhisattva.

original: 'jam dpal gzhan yang sems can gang dag bdag la bstod cing gzhan la smod pa de dag ni ngan song gsum po dag tu lo stong phrag mang por sdug bsngal myong zhing 'di nas shi 'phos nas kyang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhan yang sems can gang dag bdag la bstod cing gzhan la smod pa de dag ni ngan song gsum po dag tu lo stong phrag mang por sdug bsngal myong zhing 'di nas shi 'phos nas kyang /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, moreover, those sentient beings who praise themselves and disparage others will experience suffering in the three lower realms for many thousands of years.

original: ba lang dang / rta dang rnga mo bong bu la sogs pa dud 'gror skyes te /
analyzed: ba lang dang / rta dang rnga mo bong bu la sogs pa dud 'gror skyes te /
translated: After dying here, they will be born as animals such as cows, horses, camels, donkeys, and so forth.

original: dbyug lcag gis brdeg pa dang / bkres skom gyis nyen pa dang / khal chen pos gzir bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyug lcag gis brdeg pa dang / bkres skom gyis nyen pa dang / khal chen pos gzir bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be beaten with sticks and whips, tormented by hunger and thirst, and oppressed by heavy loads.

original: brgya la mir skyes na yang rtag tu rigs dma' ba dang / bran du 'gyur zhing gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgya la mir skyes na yang rtag tu rigs dma' ba dang / bran du 'gyur zhing gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if they are born as humans, they will always be of low caste, servants, and under the control of others.

original: gang dag sngon de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po'i mtshan thos pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba des sdug bsngal thams cad las yongs su thar bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dag sngon de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po'i mtshan thos pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba des sdug bsngal thams cad las yongs su thar bar 'gyur /
translated: Those who have heard the name of the Tathagata King of the Medicine of Lapis Lazuli Light in the past will, by that root of virtue, be completely freed from all suffering.

original: dbang po rno bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dbang po rno bar 'gyur /
translated: Their faculties will be sharp.

original: mkhas pa dang gsal ba dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / dge ba yongs su btsal ba la mngon par brtson pa rtag tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'grogs pa rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: mkhas pa dang gsal ba dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / dge ba yongs su btsal ba la mngon par brtson pa rtag tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'grogs pa rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: They will be wise, clear, and intelligent, and will be dedicated to seeking virtue. They will always find spiritual friends.

original: bdud kyi zhags pa gcod pa dang / ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i spubs gcog pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i chu klung skems par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdud kyi zhags pa gcod pa dang / ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i spubs gcog pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i chu klung skems par 'gyur /
translated: They will cut the bonds of Mara, break the shell of ignorance, and dry up the river of afflictions.

original: skye ba dang / rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / @266b sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / @266b sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be completely freed from birth, old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and distress.

original: 'jam dpal gzhan yang sems can gang dag phra ma la dga' zhing phan tshun 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang 'gyed par byed du 'jug pa dag yod de /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhan yang sems can gang dag phra ma la dga' zhing phan tshun 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang 'gyed par byed du 'jug pa dag yod de /
translated: Mañjuśrī, moreover, there are sentient beings who delight in slander and cause others to quarrel, dispute, and fight.

original: sems can de dag rtsod pa'i sems su gyur pas /
analyzed: sems can de dag rtsod pa'i sems su gyur pas /
translated: Those sentient beings, with minds of quarrel,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis mi dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'du byed de /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis mi dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'du byed de /
translated: create various nonvirtuous actions with their body, speech, and mind.

original: phan tshun gnod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun gnod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to harm each other,

original: nags tshal gyi lha dang / shing gi lha dang / ri'i lha dang / dur khrod kyi 'byung po tha dad pa 'gugs par byed /
analyzed: nags tshal gyi lha dang / shing gi lha dang / ri'i lha dang / dur khrod kyi 'byung po tha dad pa 'gugs par byed /
translated: they summon different forest spirits, tree spirits, mountain spirits, and charnel ground spirits.

original: dud 'gro dag gi srog gcod cing /
analyzed: dud 'gro dag gi srog gcod cing /
translated: They kill animals

original: sha dang khrag za ba'i srin po rnams mchod par byed de /
analyzed: sha dang khrag za ba'i srin po rnams mchod par byed de /
translated: and make offerings to rākṣasas who eat flesh and blood.

original: dgra bo de'i ming nas brjod de gzugs byas nas der rig sngags drag po sgrub cing byad dang ro langs kyi sbyor bas srog gi bar chad bya ba dang / lus rnam par gzhig par 'dod pa la gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan thos par gyur pa de dag la gang gis kyang bar chad bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: dgra bo de'i ming nas brjod de gzugs byas nas der rig sngags drag po sgrub cing byad dang ro langs kyi sbyor bas srog gi bar chad bya ba dang / lus rnam par gzhig par 'dod pa la gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan thos par gyur pa de dag la gang gis kyang bar chad bya bar mi nus te /
translated: If someone were to make an effigy of their enemy, recite powerful mantras over it, and perform black magic or zombie magic to create obstacles to their life or destroy their body, those who have heard the name of the thus-gone one King of Medicine, Lapis Lazuli Light, will not be able to be harmed by anyone.

original: de dag phan tshun byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / gnod sems med pa'i sems su gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / gnod sems med pa'i sems su gnas par 'gyur /
translated: They will abide in a mind of love, a mind of benefit, and a mind free from malice toward each other.

original: rang rang gi bdog pas chog shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi bdog pas chog shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be content with their own possessions.

original: 'jam dpal gzhan yang 'khor bzhi po rnams dang / gzhan yang dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhan yang 'khor bzhi po rnams dang / gzhan yang dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, moreover, the four retinues and other faithful sons and daughters of good family should make a statue of the thus-gone one King of Medicine, Lapis Lazuli Light, and recite his mantra.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i bsnyen gnas pa gang dag bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nub phyogs gang na de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dpag med bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du skye bar shog shig ces smon
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i bsnyen gnas pa gang dag bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nub phyogs gang na de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dpag med bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du skye bar shog shig ces smon
translated: “Noble sons and daughters who observe the one-day upavāsa precepts with its eight components and who pray, ‘By this root of virtue, may I be reborn in Sukhāvatī, the world to the west where the Tathāgata Amitāyus resides,’

original: lam btab pa de dag las /
analyzed: lam btab pa de dag las /
translated: will be reborn there.

original: gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan thos pa de dag 'chi kar yang byang chub sems dpa' brgyad rdzu 'phrul gyis lhag nas lam ston te /
analyzed: gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan thos pa de dag 'chi kar yang byang chub sems dpa' brgyad rdzu 'phrul gyis lhag nas lam ston te /
translated: Those who hear the name of the Tathāgata King of Medicine, Lapis Lazuli Radiance, will be shown the path by eight bodhisattvas who miraculously appear at their deathbed.

original: bde ba can der padma tshon sna tshogs can la rdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba can der padma tshon sna tshogs can la rdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be reborn miraculously in Sukhāvatī, in a multicolored lotus.

original: gang la la lha'i 'jig rten du skyes pa de dag ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zad par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang la la lha'i 'jig rten du skyes pa de dag ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zad par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Those who are reborn in the world of the gods will not exhaust their previous roots of virtue.

original: ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: They will not go to the lower realms.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas kyang mi'i 'jig rten 'dir gling bzhi pa'i dbang phyug 'khor los @267a * //
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas kyang mi'i 'jig rten 'dir gling bzhi pa'i dbang phyug 'khor los @267a * //
translated: Then, after death, they are born in this human world as the lord of the four continents, a universal monarch.🔽

original: sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur te /
translated: Then, after passing away, they will be born in this human world as a universal monarch, a lord of the four continents.

original: sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la dgod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la dgod par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will establish many hundreds of thousands of sentient beings in the ten virtuous actions.

original: gzhan du na yang rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba mang po 'byor ba'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na yang rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i khyim dag dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba mang po 'byor ba'i khyim dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, they will be born in the families of kings, brahmins, and householders, in great families with abundant wealth, grain, treasuries, and granaries.

original: gzugs dang dbang phyug dang / g-yog 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / dpa' ba dang / rtul phod pa dang / tshan po che chen po'i stobs kyi shugs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang dbang phyug dang / g-yog 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / dpa' ba dang / rtul phod pa dang / tshan po che chen po'i stobs kyi shugs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have perfect bodies, power, and retinues, and will be brave, heroic, and strong as a great champion.

original: bud med gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po'i mtshan thos pa de'i bud med kyi dngos po de tha ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bud med gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po'i mtshan thos pa de'i bud med kyi dngos po de tha ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Any woman who hears the name of the Tathāgata King of the Radiance of Medicinal Herbs Lapis Lazuli will know that her state as a woman will be her last.

original: 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i sku gzugs byas te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i sku gzugs byas te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, one should make an image of the Tathāgata King of the Radiance of Medicinal Herbs Lapis Lazuli.

original: nyin zhag bdun du bsnyen gnas la gnas la kha zas gtsang ma bza' zhing lus legs par bkrus te /
analyzed: nyin zhag bdun du bsnyen gnas la gnas la kha zas gtsang ma bza' zhing lus legs par bkrus te /
translated: For seven days one should observe the purificatory fast, eat pure food, and thoroughly wash one’s body.

original: gos dri ma med pa bgo zhing phyogs gtsang mar me tog sna tshogs kyi sil ma bkram pa /
analyzed: gos dri ma med pa bgo zhing phyogs gtsang mar me tog sna tshogs kyi sil ma bkram pa /
translated: One should put on clean clothes and in a clean place scatter various flower petals.

original: spos sna tshogs kyis bdugs pa /
analyzed: spos sna tshogs kyis bdugs pa /
translated: One should burn various incense

original: ras dang gdugs dang rgyal mtshan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i sa phyogs su dri ma dang / rnyog pa dang / gnod sems med pa'i sems dang byams pa dang btang snyoms dang mnyam pa'i sems su bya /
analyzed: ras dang gdugs dang rgyal mtshan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i sa phyogs su dri ma dang / rnyog pa dang / gnod sems med pa'i sems dang byams pa dang btang snyoms dang mnyam pa'i sems su bya /
translated: and adorn the place with various cloths, parasols, and banners. One should have a mind free from defilements, agitation, and malice, and be loving and impartial.

original: rol mo'i sgra dang sil snyan dang / glu dbyangs blang zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs de la bskor ba byas te /
analyzed: rol mo'i sgra dang sil snyan dang / glu dbyangs blang zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs de la bskor ba byas te /
translated: One should play musical instruments and cymbals, sing songs, and circumambulate the image of the Tathāgata.

original: de'i sngon gyi smon lam yang yid la bya zhing mdo 'di yang bton na gang bsam pa dang / gang smon pa'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i sngon gyi smon lam yang yid la bya zhing mdo 'di yang bton na gang bsam pa dang / gang smon pa'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one brings to mind the former aspirations and recites this sūtra, all the wishes and aspirations one has in mind will be fulfilled.

original: tshe ring bar smon na ni tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe ring bar smon na ni tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one aspires to a long life, one’s life will be long.

original: longs spyod dang ldan par smon na ni longs spyod 'byor par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod dang ldan par smon na ni longs spyod 'byor par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one aspires to enjoy wealth, one’s wealth will increase.

original: dbang phyug dang ldan bar smon na ni tshegs chung dus rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ldan bar smon na ni tshegs chung dus rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one aspires to have power, one will obtain it with little difficulty.

original: bu 'dod na ni bu rnyed par 'gyur ro //🔽gang dag sdig pa can gyi rmi lam rmis sam /🔽gang du bya khva'am ltas ngan mthong ngam /

analyzed: gnod pa dang mi bde ba thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / 'dod dgu'i re ba rdzogs shing bsam pa thams cad yid bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ba de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi mtshan dang sngon gyi smon lam gyi khyad par rgyas pa'i mdo sde ston pa bcom ldan 'das dpal sh'akya thub pa la dmigs kyis zhu ba mdzad
translated: In the midst of the assembly, he addressed the Blessed One, the glorious Shakyamuni, the teacher of the sutra that reveals the names of the seven tathagatas and the extensive details of their past aspirations:

original: cing gdan 'dzom pa'i dbus su 'di skad ces bcom ldan 'das slad ma'i tshe slad ma'i dus na /
analyzed: cing gdan 'dzom pa'i dbus su 'di skad ces bcom ldan 'das slad ma'i tshe slad ma'i dus na /
translated: Bhagavat, in the future, in the later times,

original: gang dag mdo 'di 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / 'chad pa dang / gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston pa dang / yi ger 'dri ba dang / yi ger 'drir stsol ba dang / glegs bam la bris te me tog dang /
analyzed: gang dag mdo 'di 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / 'chad pa dang / gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston pa dang / yi ger 'dri ba dang / yi ger 'drir stsol ba dang / glegs bam la bris te me tog dang /
translated: Those sons or daughters of good family who hold this sūtra, read it, explain it, teach it extensively to others, write it, cause it to be written, write it out in book form, and honor it with flowers,

original: bdug pa dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan rnams kyis bkur stir bgyid pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la /
analyzed: bdug pa dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan rnams kyis bkur stir bgyid pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la /
translated: incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, parasols, and banners,

original: bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan rnam pa sna tshogs bsgrag par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i mtshan rnam pa sna tshogs bsgrag par bgyi'o //

analyzed: tha na rmi lam du yang sangs rgyas kyi mtshan rna lam du nye bar bsgrag par bgyi'o //
translated: I will cause the Buddha’s name to be heard even in a dream.

original: tshon sna lnga pa'i ras rnams kyis dkris te /
analyzed: tshon sna lnga pa'i ras rnams kyis dkris te /
translated: They should wrap it in five-colored cloths,

original: phyogs gtsang mar bzhag na gang na mdo sde 'di gnas pa der rgyal po chen po bzhi 'khor dang bcas pa dang / lha bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gzhan yang mchi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gtsang mar bzhag na gang na mdo sde 'di gnas pa der rgyal po chen po bzhi 'khor dang bcas pa dang / lha bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gzhan yang mchi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is placed in a clean place, the four great kings and their retinues, and many quintillions of other gods will come to the place where this sutra is.

original: mdo sde 'di 'dzin pa de dag dus ma lags par 'gum par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di 'dzin pa de dag dus ma lags par 'gum par mi 'gyur /

original: sus kyang mdangs phrogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: sus kyang mdangs phrogs par mi nus te /

original: phrogs na yang slar 'phrog par 'gyur ro zhes bgyi ba la sogs pa gsungs shing /
analyzed: phrogs na yang slar 'phrog par 'gyur ro zhes bgyi ba la sogs pa gsungs shing /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bka' yang dag pa tshad mar gyur pas @269b zhal gyis bzhes pa bzhin du deng 'dir yang mchod pa'i tshogs sbyar ba'i pho brang gi dkyil 'khor 'dir bzhugs te mchod pa bzhes shing /
translated: In accordance with the authentic and valid words of the noble ones, who have accepted this, here today as well, in this palace mandala where the collection of offerings is prepared, please remain and accept the offerings.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gdan 'dzom pa la thugs dam las glengs te bskul ba dang / mdo sde'i cho ga rdzogs par bskang ba'i phrin las mdzad de /
translated: In the assembly of tathagatas, discuss the sacred bond and exhort, and perform the activity of completing the ritual of the sutra.

original: mdo sde'i phan yon ji skad bka' stsal pa thams cad bdag cag la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyis thob par byin gyis brlab cing stsal du gsol /
analyzed: mdo sde'i phan yon ji skad bka' stsal pa thams cad bdag cag la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyis thob par byin gyis brlab cing stsal du gsol /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyabs grol la phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su mchi'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa skyabs grol dus ngan pa'i sems can phongs shing sdug bsngal ba rnams la thugs brtse bar dgongs nas /
translated: Bhagavat, the noble Kshitigarbha, considering with compassion the poor and suffering beings of the degenerate age,

analyzed: ston pa bcom ldan 'das gdan 'dzom pa'i spyan sngar /
translated: in the presence of the assembled teachers, the bhagavats,🔽said this:

analyzed: 'di skad du btsun pa bcom ldan 'das slad ma'i tshe slad ma'i dus na /
translated: “Venerable bhagavats, in the future,

analyzed: sems can bro nad sna tshogs kyis lus yongs su gzir te /
