original: yun ring po'i bro nad kyis lus kyi sha bas shing /
analyzed: yun ring po'i bro nad kyis lus kyi sha bas shing /
translated: For a long time, their bodies will be emaciated by illness.

original: bkres pa dang / skom pas gre ba dang mchu ni bskams /
analyzed: bkres pa dang / skom pas gre ba dang mchu ni bskams /
translated: Their throats and lips will be parched by hunger and thirst.

original: 'gum pa la ni mngon du phyogs /
analyzed: 'gum pa la ni mngon du phyogs /
translated: They will be facing death.

original: mdza' bshes dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams du ba rnams kyis ni bskor /
analyzed: mdza' bshes dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams du ba rnams kyis ni bskor /

original: phyogs rnams ni mun par mthong /
analyzed: phyogs rnams ni mun par mthong /

original: gshin rje'i mi rnams kyis ni sgor drangs te /
analyzed: gshin rje'i mi rnams kyis ni sgor drangs te /
translated: The henchmen of the Lord of Death lead him to the door.

analyzed: de'i lus 'di na nyal yang rnam par shes pa chos kyi rgyal po gshin rje'i mdun du khrid cing /

original: mi de dang lhan cig skyes pa'i lha slad bzhin du 'brang ba gang lags pa de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba bgyis pa de dag thams cad legs par yi ger bris nas chos kyi rgyal po gshin rje la phul ba dang / chos kyi rgyal po gshin rjes de la dris shing brtags nas /

translated: The god who was born together with that person and has followed him around writes down all the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions he has done and presents them to the Dharma King Yama. The Dharma King Yama questions him and examines him.

analyzed: dge ba'am mi dge ba ji ltar bgyis pa de bzhin du bsgo ba la /
translated: He is ordered according to the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions he has done.

original: gang dag nad pa de'i don du bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de la skyabs su mchi zhing /
analyzed: gang dag nad pa de'i don du bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de la skyabs su mchi zhing /

analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i spyor bas mchod pa bgyis na / de'i rnam par shes pa slar ldog cing rmi lam rmis pa bzhin du /

analyzed: bdag nyid kyis 'tshal bar 'gyur ba'i gnas der mchis te /
translated: They will return to the place where they were, as if they had woken up from a dream.

original: yang na ni gdugs bdun /
analyzed: yang na ni gdugs bdun /
translated: After seven days,

original: yang na ni gdugs nye shu rtsa gcig /
analyzed: yang na ni gdugs nye shu rtsa gcig /

original: @270a * // yang na ni gdugs sum cu rtsa lnga /
analyzed: @270a * // yang na ni gdugs sum cu rtsa lnga /

analyzed: yang na ni gdugs bzhi bcu rtsa dgu la /

analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa slar bzlog cing dran pa rnyed la /

analyzed: de dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du 'gyur te /

analyzed: srog gi slad du yang sdig pa'i las mi bgyid do //
translated: Even for the sake of their life, they will not commit any negative actions.

analyzed: mchod pa'i sbyor ba ni btsun pa kun dga' bo gang dag nad chen po las yongs su thar par 'dod pa de dag gis /

analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun la zas dang skom rnams dang / yo byad thams cad kyis ci nus su mchod pa dang rim gro bya /
translated: They should make offerings to the saṅgha of monks of food and drink and all the necessary articles to the best of their ability.

original: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du bcom ldan 'das sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi mtshan yid la bya /

analyzed: mdo sde 'di lan bzhi bcu rtsa dgur gdon par bya'o //

analyzed: zhag bzhi bcu rtsa dgur mar me bud par bya'o //
translated: For forty-nine days they should keep the lamps burning.

original: sku gzugs bdun bya'o //
analyzed: sku gzugs bdun bya'o //

original: sku gzugs re re'i spyan sngar mar me bdun bdun gzhag go //
analyzed: sku gzugs re re'i spyan sngar mar me bdun bdun gzhag go //

analyzed: mar me re re'i tshad kyang shing rta'i 'phang lo tsam du bya ste /

analyzed: ci nas kyang zhag bzhi bcu rtsa dgur mar me mi zad par bya'o //

analyzed: tshon sna lnga pa'i ba dan bzhi bcu rtsa dgu las lhag par bya'o //

analyzed: btson pa kun dga' po gzhan yang rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba rnams la nad kyis gnod pa'am /

analyzed: rang ngam pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis gnod pa'am / rgyu skar ram /

analyzed: gza' zla ba'am /
translated: or by the planet Moon,

original: gza' nyi ma'i gnod pa'am /
analyzed: gza' nyi ma'i gnod pa'am /
translated: or by the planet Sun,

original: dus ma yin pa'i rlung ngam /
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i rlung ngam /
translated: or by untimely wind,

original: char ram than pa'i gnod pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: char ram than pa'i gnod pa yang rung ste /
translated: rain, or drought,

original: gnod pa dang / nad 'og pa dang / 'khrug pa zhig nye bar gnas par gyur na rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba des sems can la byams pa'i sems su bya /
analyzed: gnod pa dang / nad 'og pa dang / 'khrug pa zhig nye bar gnas par gyur na rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba des sems can la byams pa'i sems su bya /
translated: if any such harm, disease, or conflict should occur, then that king, a kṣatriya anointed on the crown of his head, should have a loving mind toward beings.

analyzed: btson du bzung ba rnams gtang bar bya zhing gang du smos pa bzhin du /
translated: in accordance with what is said,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de la de lta bu'i mchod pa byas na /
translated: make such offerings to the Blessed One, the King of Medicinal Herbs, the Radiance of Lapis Lazuli.

original: rgyal po de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dang / bcom ldan 'das sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi khyad par gyis /
analyzed: rgyal po de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dang / bcom ldan 'das sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po de'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi khyad par gyis /
translated: By that root of merit of that king and by the special former aspirations of the Blessed One, the King of Medicinal Herbs, the Radiance of Lapis Lazuli,

analyzed: yul bde ba dang lo legs par 'gyur /

original: rlung dang char dus su ldang zhing lo tog 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: rlung dang char dus su ldang zhing lo tog 'grub par 'gyur /

analyzed: yul de na gnas pa'i sems can @270b thams cad kyang nad med pa dang / bde ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba mad bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yul der gnong sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / sha za ma rungs pas sems can rnams la gtse bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: ltas ngan thams cad mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltas ngan thams cad mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: rgyal po de'i tshe dang mdog dang stobs dang / nad med pa dang dbang phyug rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bgyi ba la sogs pa gsungs shing 'phags pa'i bka' yang dag pa tshad mar gyur pas zhal gyis bzhes pa bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyal po de'i tshe dang mdog dang stobs dang / nad med pa dang dbang phyug rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bgyi ba la sogs pa gsungs shing 'phags pa'i bka' yang dag pa tshad mar gyur pas zhal gyis bzhes pa bzhin du /
translated: In the same way, the noble words of the Buddha are true and valid.

original: deng 'dir yang mchod pa'i tshogs sbyar ba'i pho brang gi dkyil 'khor 'dir bzhugs te /
analyzed: deng 'dir yang mchod pa'i tshogs sbyar ba'i pho brang gi dkyil 'khor 'dir bzhugs te /
translated: Now, in this palace mandala of the assembled offerings,

original: mchod pa bzhes shing de bzhin gshegs pa gdan 'dzom pa la thugs dam las glengs te bskul ba dang / mdo sde'i cho ga rdzogs par bskang ba'i phrin las mdzad de /
analyzed: mchod pa bzhes shing de bzhin gshegs pa gdan 'dzom pa la thugs dam las glengs te bskul ba dang / mdo sde'i cho ga rdzogs par bskang ba'i phrin las mdzad de /
translated: accept the offerings and, in the presence of the assembled thus-gone ones, please discuss your spiritual practice and exhort one another.

original: mdo sde'i phan yon ji skad bka' stsal pa thams cad bdag cag la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyis 'thob par byin gyis brlab cing stsal du gsol /
analyzed: mdo sde'i phan yon ji skad bka' stsal pa thams cad bdag cag la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyis 'thob par byin gyis brlab cing stsal du gsol /
translated: Please perform the activity of fulfilling the ritual of the sūtra and bless us so that all the benefits of the sūtra, as taught by the Buddha, will be obtained by all sentient beings, including myself.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpal phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Śrī Vajrapāṇi.

original: mchod do skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: mchod do skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I make offerings and go for refuge.

analyzed: tshangs pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / rgyal po chen g /
translated: Brahmā, Śakra, lord of the gods, and the great kings

original: rgyal po chen r dang / 'phags skyes po dang / mig mi bzang dang / ku be ra la sogs pa dam pa'i chos song ba'i lha'i dge bsnyen thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rgyal po chen r dang / 'phags skyes po dang / mig mi bzang dang / ku be ra la sogs pa dam pa'i chos song ba'i lha'i dge bsnyen thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Vaiśravaṇa, Virūḍhaka, Virūpākṣa, and Kubera, and so forth, all the divine upāsakas who uphold the sublime Dharma, I pay homage to you all.

original: mchod do skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: mchod do skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I make offerings and go for refuge.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje dang / tshangs pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / rgyal po chen po yul 'khor srung dang / 'phags skyes po dang / mig mi bzang dang / ku be ra la sogs pa dam pa'i chos skyong ba lha'i dge bsnyen chen po rnams kyis /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag gis de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi smon lam gyi khyad par rgyas pa yang thos /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang mngon sum du mthong ste /

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo'am /

analyzed: thams cad du bsrung bar bgyi'o //

analyzed: 'phel ba'i bka' mchid kyang bgyi /

analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi khyad par rgyas pa'i mdo la sogs pa gsung rab dam pa'i chos yun ring du rgyas par bgyi ba dang / sgo thams cad nas chos spyod pa rnams la bar chad dang bgegs su gyur ba bdud kyi phyogs thams cad dang /
translated: May all the forces of Mara that create obstacles and hindrances to the practice of Dharma in all its aspects,

translated: and all the different kinds of malevolent spirits who cause disease among humans and animals in this region, who destroy crops with drought, frost, hail and so on, who display many harmful and inauspicious omens,🔽and who are hostile to sentient beings, be pacified.

translated: May all the different kinds of malevolent spirits who are active in this region, and in particular those that have been sent by the evil actions of so and so,

analyzed: che ge mo'i lus dang / srog dang / chus srid dang / dbang phyug dang / 'khor dang / yo byad la sogs pa gang yang rung ba la ci yang rung ba'i sgo nas gnod pa bgyid pa'i gdon bgegs ci mchis pa thams cad gang la gang 'tsham pa'i thabs kyis gdul zhing 'khon dang gnod pa'i bsam pa 'dor du stsal te zhi ba dang dge ba
translated: Whatever the case, they are all to be subdued by whatever means are appropriate, and they are to be made to abandon any thoughts of hostility or harm.

original: dang byams pa'i bsam pa can du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dang byams pa'i bsam pa can du 'gyur zhing /
translated: They are to be made to adopt thoughts of peace, virtue, and love.

analyzed: sngon chad bkra mi shis pa dang gnod pa'i sbyor ba bgyis ba rnams kyang 'jog cing 'dor du stsal /

translated: For the sake of the welfare, benefit, and happiness of gods and humans, the seven thus-gone ones blessed the extensive special previous aspirations and perfectly proclaimed them from their glorious throats.

original: ri rab ri'i rgyal po ni gnas nas 'pho yang gda'/
analyzed: ri rab ri'i rgyal po ni gnas nas 'pho yang gda'/
translated: The king of mountains, Mount Meru, may move from its place.

original: rgya mtsho chen po ni dus las yol yang gda'/🔽nam mkha' ni dog sar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po ni dus las yol yang gda'/ nam mkha' ni dog sar 'gyur /
translated: The great ocean may pass beyond its time.🔽Space may become confined.

original: dog sa ni nam mkhar 'gyur /🔽chab ni zhugs su 'gyur /
analyzed: dog sa ni nam mkhar 'gyur / chab ni zhugs su 'gyur /
translated: Confined space may become space.🔽Water may become fire.

original: zhugs ni chab tu 'gyur /
analyzed: zhugs ni chab tu 'gyur /
translated: Fire may become water.

original: bser ma ni zhags pas gzungs du rung yang gda'i /
analyzed: bser ma ni zhags pas gzungs du rung yang gda'i /

original: lha dang mi'i ston pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen nyid thams cad gzigs pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i ston pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen nyid thams cad gzigs pa /
translated: The teacher of gods and humans, the perfect, complete Buddha, the omniscient one who sees all,

analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyis kun du spyod pa la yongs su ma dag pa mi mnga' ba /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas legs par gsungs pa'i bka' ni gzhan du 'gyur pa ma mchis pa lags na /

analyzed: da yang gdan 'dzom pa chen pos tshog yongs su rdzogs par bskangs te /
translated: now, with this great gathering of the assembly, may my aspirations be completely fulfilled.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' yang dag @274a * //
translated: The teachings of the Tathagata are true,

original: pa chad mar gyur ba /
analyzed: pa chad mar gyur ba /

analyzed: 'gyur ba mi mnga' ba'i bden pa mngon sum du bstan du gsol /

original: 'phags pa gdan 'dzom pa'i spyir mchod pa ci 'byor pa phul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi smon lam gyi khyad par rgyas pa'i mdo sde las 'byung ba bzhin du mchod pa'i tshogs sbyar ba'i pho brang gi dkyil 'khor 'dir /
analyzed: 'phags pa gdan 'dzom pa'i spyir mchod pa ci 'byor pa phul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi smon lam gyi khyad par rgyas pa'i mdo sde las 'byung ba bzhin du mchod pa'i tshogs sbyar ba'i pho brang gi dkyil 'khor 'dir /
translated: Offer whatever you have as a general offering to the noble ones assembled and recite the extensive aspiration prayers that appear in the Sutra of the Special Qualities of the Aspirations of the Seven Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan legs par yongs bsgrags dpal gyi rgyal po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che dang zla ba dang padmas rab tu brgyan pa mkhas pa gzi brjid sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mtshan legs par yongs bsgrags dpal gyi rgyal po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che dang zla ba dang padmas rab tu brgyan pa mkhas pa gzi brjid sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po dang /
translated: the Tathagata Arhat Samyak-sambuddha Yasodaya-shri-raja, the Tathagata Ratna-chandra-padma-alankrita-vidusha-tejas-ghosa-raja,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gser bzangs dri med rin chen snang brtul zhugs grub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan med mchog dpal dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos bsgrags rgya mtsho'i dbyangs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya mtsho mchog gi blos rnam par rol ba mngon par mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gser bzangs dri med rin chen snang brtul zhugs grub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan med mchog dpal dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos bsgrags rgya mtsho'i dbyangs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya mtsho mchog gi blos rnam par rol ba mngon par mkhyen pa dang /
translated: the Tathagata Kanakabhadramala-ratna-prabha-vrata-siddhi, the Tathagata Asokottama-shri, the Tathagata Dharma-megha-sagara-nirgho~a, the Tathagata Dharma-sagara-vara-mati-vikrina-abhisambodhi,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po dang / ston pa bcom ldan 'das dpal sh'akya thub pa 'khor dang bcas pa spyan drangs nas mtshan nas brjod de phyag btsal ba dang / mchod cing 'phags pa de dag gi sngon gyi smon lam khyad par can dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'urya'i 'od kyi rgyal po dang / ston pa bcom ldan 'das dpal sh'akya thub pa 'khor dang bcas pa spyan drangs nas mtshan nas brjod de phyag btsal ba dang / mchod cing 'phags pa de dag gi sngon gyi smon lam khyad par can dang /
translated: He invited the Tathagata King of Medicine, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance, and the teacher, the Bhagavan, the glorious Shakyamuni, together with his retinue. He invited them by name, paid homage, made offerings, and made prayers of aspiration in accordance with the special aspirations of the noble ones and the words of the Buddha.

original: bka' lung dang mthun par smon lam gsol ba dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa de dag gi spyan sngar sdig pa bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba phul ba dang bskul zhing gsol ba btab pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams ci mchis pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: bka' lung dang mthun par smon lam gsol ba dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa de dag gi spyan sngar sdig pa bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba phul ba dang bskul zhing gsol ba btab pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams ci mchis pa'i stobs dang /
translated: He confessed his negative actions in the presence of the noble ones, offered them his admiration, and made requests and supplications. He dedicated all the merit that he had accumulated through these actions.

original: 'phags pa de dag gi mthu dpal dang byin gyi rlabs kyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa de dag gi mthu dpal dang byin gyi rlabs kyis /
translated: Through the power of the noble ones, their splendor and their blessings,

original: lha sras kyi zhal snga nas kyis thog ma ma mchis pa'i 'khor ba nas bsags pa'i dngos sdig dang / sgrib pa ci mnga' ba thams cad byang bar gyur cig / sku la bsnyun mi mnga' zhing sku tshe dpag tu med pa ring ba dang /
analyzed: lha sras kyi zhal snga nas kyis thog ma ma mchis pa'i 'khor ba nas bsags pa'i dngos sdig dang / sgrib pa ci mnga' ba thams cad byang bar gyur cig / sku la bsnyun mi mnga' zhing sku tshe dpag tu med pa ring ba dang /
translated: May you be free of illness and live a long, immeasurable life.

original: dbu rmog pa tsan pa dang / chab srid 'byam par rgya che zhing /
analyzed: dbu rmog pa tsan pa dang / chab srid 'byam par rgya che zhing /
translated: May your dominion be vast and your rule extensive.🔽 May you attain the glory of the world and of the world beyond.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das @274b pa'i dpal phun sum tshogs pa la mnga' brnyes par gyur cig / mthar yang tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i g-yung drung gi sku chos kyi rgyal po chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi go 'phang brnyes par gyur cig
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das @274b pa'i dpal phun sum tshogs pa la mnga' brnyes par gyur cig / mthar yang tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i g-yung drung gi sku chos kyi rgyal po chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi go 'phang brnyes par gyur cig
translated: May you finally attain the state of the great Dharma king, the Bhagavan Buddha, having completed the two collections.

original: / chab 'og tu gtogs pa'i 'bangs thams cad kyang phyi nang gi gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi zhing bde zhing skyid pa dang / 'phral yun du legs pa'i chos bzang po la gnas par gyur cig / mnga' ris kyi yul khams thams cad du yang mi nad dang /
analyzed: / chab 'og tu gtogs pa'i 'bangs thams cad kyang phyi nang gi gnod pa thams cad rab tu zhi zhing bde zhing skyid pa dang / 'phral yun du legs pa'i chos bzang po la gnas par gyur cig / mnga' ris kyi yul khams thams cad du yang mi nad dang /
translated: May all the people within the kingdom be free from all inner and outer harm, and may they be happy and joyful. May they abide in the excellent Dharma, both now and in the future.

original: phyug sa nad dang / lo nyas dang dgra'i tshogs la sogs pa'i gnod pa dang / bkra mi shis pa'i bag ci yang mi 'byung ba dang / char chu dus su bab ste /
analyzed: phyug sa nad dang / lo nyas dang dgra'i tshogs la sogs pa'i gnod pa dang / bkra mi shis pa'i bag ci yang mi 'byung ba dang / char chu dus su bab ste /
translated: May there be no epidemics among humans or livestock, no crop failures, no invasions by foreign powers, and no other such calamities. May there be no misfortune of any kind.🔽May the rains fall in season,

original: lo phyugs 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang / bde skyid kyi dpal phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig / dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas shing /
analyzed: lo phyugs 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang / bde skyid kyi dpal phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig / dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas shing /
translated: and may the harvests of crops and herds be abundant. May the glory of happiness and well-being be complete. May the sacred Dharma remain for a long time.🔽May it spread and flourish in every way.

original: sgo thams cad nas dar zhing rgyas par gyur cig / sgo'i bsod nams bgyid pa la ni mjug gi bsngo bas so so nas ji ltar dad pa bzhin du bris te 'debs su stsal lo //
analyzed: sgo thams cad nas dar zhing rgyas par gyur cig / sgo'i bsod nams bgyid pa la ni mjug gi bsngo bas so so nas ji ltar dad pa bzhin du bris te 'debs su stsal lo //
translated: As for the merit of this gate, I have written it down according to my faith, and I have had it inscribed and installed by the concluding dedication.

original: smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'og tu /
translated: After all the aspirations have been fulfilled,

original: gyes khar bzod par gsol zhing slar gshegs par gnas par bgyi ba /🔽bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan legs par yongs bsgrags dpal gyi rgyal po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che dang zla ba dang padmas rab tu brgyan pa mkhas pa gzi brjid sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gser bzangs dri med rin chen snang brtul zhugs grub pa dang /
analyzed: gyes khar bzod par gsol zhing slar gshegs par gnas par bgyi ba / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan legs par yongs bsgrags dpal gyi rgyal po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che dang zla ba dang padmas rab tu brgyan pa mkhas pa gzi brjid sgra dbyangs kyi rgyal po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gser bzangs dri med rin chen snang brtul zhugs grub pa dang /
translated: at the time of parting, one should request forbearance and remain in the place of departure.🔽Blessed One, Tathāgata Well-Proclaimed Glory King, Tathāgata Adorned with Jewels, Moon, and Lotuses, Wise One, King of Resplendent Melody, Tathāgata Pure Golden Color, Stainless, Jewel Light, Accomplished Spiritual Practice,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan med mchog dpal dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos bsgrags rgya mtsho'i dbyangs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya mtsho mchog gi blos rnam par rol pa mngon par mkhyen pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'ury'a'i 'od kyi rgyal po dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan med mchog dpal dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos bsgrags rgya mtsho'i dbyangs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya mtsho mchog gi blos rnam par rol pa mngon par mkhyen pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa sman gyi bla bee d'ury'a'i 'od kyi rgyal po dang /
translated: Tathāgata Supreme Glory of No Sorrow, Tathāgata Ocean Sound Proclaiming the Dharma, Tathāgata Supreme Mind of the Ocean of Dharma, Manifesting Omniscience, Tathāgata King of the Light of Lapis Lazuli Medicine,

original: ston pa bcom ldan 'das dpal sh'akya thub pa 'khor dang bcas pa gdan 'dzom pa spyan drangs nas mtshan nas brjod de /
analyzed: ston pa bcom ldan 'das dpal sh'akya thub pa 'khor dang bcas pa gdan 'dzom pa spyan drangs nas mtshan nas brjod de /
translated: Invite the teacher, the Blessed One, the glorious Shakyamuni, together with his retinue, to assemble and recite his name.

original: phyag btsal zhing mchod pa dang / mdo dang mthun par smon lam gsol ba dang / che ge mo la sogs pa 'gro ba mang po'i don mdzad par gsol ba'i skabs 'dir /
analyzed: phyag btsal zhing mchod pa dang / mdo dang mthun par smon lam gsol ba dang / che ge mo la sogs pa 'gro ba mang po'i don mdzad par gsol ba'i skabs 'dir /
translated: Prostrate, make offerings, and in accordance with the sutra, make aspirations and request that he act for the benefit of many beings, such as so-and-so.

original: bdag cag dus ngan pa'i sems can spyod pa dman zhing ma dag par gyur pas ma 'tshal @275a * //
analyzed: bdag cag dus ngan pa'i sems can spyod pa dman zhing ma dag par gyur pas ma 'tshal @275a * //
translated: At this point, say, We are sentient beings of the degenerate age with inferior and impure conduct. We do not know

original: ba dang / bag ma mchis pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi spyod pa thams cad nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'dres pa dang / mchod pa'i dngos po chung zhing ngan la gtsang pras ma phyed pa dang / mdo las 'byung ba'i cho ga bzhin du ma lcogs pa la sogs pa 'khrul zhing nongs par gyur pa thams cad 'phags pa thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa thams cad la bzod par gsol zhing mchis na /
analyzed: ba dang / bag ma mchis pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi spyod pa thams cad nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'dres pa dang / mchod pa'i dngos po chung zhing ngan la gtsang pras ma phyed pa dang / mdo las 'byung ba'i cho ga bzhin du ma lcogs pa la sogs pa 'khrul zhing nongs par gyur pa thams cad 'phags pa thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa thams cad la bzod par gsol zhing mchis na /
translated: And due to carelessness and so forth, all my physical, verbal and mental actions are mixed with the afflictions, and the objects of offering are small, poor and not well prepared, and I have not managed to do things according to the ritual as it appears in the sutras, and so forth. I request forbearance from all the noble ones endowed with great compassion for all these mistakes and errors.

original: thugs brtse bar mdzad de bzod par bzhes shing /
analyzed: thugs brtse bar mdzad de bzod par bzhes shing /
translated: With loving kindness, please accept my forbearance.

original: 'phral yun gnyis su bdag cag la sgrib pa dang gnod par mi 'gyur bar byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
analyzed: 'phral yun gnyis su bdag cag la sgrib pa dang gnod par mi 'gyur bar byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
translated: Please bless me so that I may not be harmed or obscured in the present and in the future.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis kyang deng ngam dgung 'di'i bar du bdag cag la sogs pa 'gro ba phongs shing nyam thag pa'i sems can thams cad kyis phan pa dang bde ba'i don mdzad cing bka' stsal pa yang /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis kyang deng ngam dgung 'di'i bar du bdag cag la sogs pa 'gro ba phongs shing nyam thag pa'i sems can thams cad kyis phan pa dang bde ba'i don mdzad cing bka' stsal pa yang /
translated: The noble ones have also acted and spoken for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to all of us and other sentient beings who are destitute and suffering until this very day.

original: da dung yang bdag cag la thugs brtse bas yang dang yang du gdan 'dzam par mdzad par dgongs shing /
analyzed: da dung yang bdag cag la thugs brtse bas yang dang yang du gdan 'dzam par mdzad par dgongs shing /
translated: They have also thought about how to be compassionate toward us and to sit on their thrones again and again.

original: so so'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa rnams su 'gro ba'i don la gshegs su gsol /
analyzed: so so'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa rnams su 'gro ba'i don la gshegs su gsol /
translated: They have gone to their pure buddhafields to benefit beings.

original: mjug 'dir bsngo ba'i tshigs bcad kyang bklag go //
analyzed: mjug 'dir bsngo ba'i tshigs bcad kyang bklag go //
translated: At the end, one should also recite the verses of dedication.

original: rdzogs so / //
analyzed: rdzogs so / //
translated: This concludes the text.

original: / dbang phyug dam pa'i mnga' bdag dpal lha btsan po lha sras khri srong lde'u btsan gyi sku tshe bsring ba dang / dbu rmog btsan pa dang / chab srid mtho ba dang / las sgrib sbyang ba dang / tshogs gnyis spel ba'i ched du /
analyzed: / dbang phyug dam pa'i mnga' bdag dpal lha btsan po lha sras khri srong lde'u btsan gyi sku tshe bsring ba dang / dbu rmog btsan pa dang / chab srid mtho ba dang / las sgrib sbyang ba dang / tshogs gnyis spel ba'i ched du /
translated: In order to prolong the life of the glorious divine king, the divine son Trisong Detsen, the supreme lord of power, to strengthen his helmet, to elevate his rule, to purify his karmic obscurations, and to increase his two accumulations,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi khyad par rgyas pa'i mdo sde'i man ngag / slob dpon bo dhi satvas mdzad//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bdun gyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi khyad par rgyas pa'i mdo sde'i man ngag / slob dpon bo dhi satvas mdzad//
translated: The Instruction of the Sutra of the Extensive Special Pledges of the Seven Tathagatas, composed by Master Bodhisattva.
